com.gfycat.framesequence.view

Class FrameSequenceView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.AppCompatImageView
      • com.gfycat.framesequence.view.FrameSequenceView

  • public class FrameSequenceView
extends android.support.v7.widget.AppCompatImageView
    Displays a Gfycat using animated image as a source.

    This is an android.widget.ImageView that displays animated images frame-by-frame once setup(FrameSequenceSource) is called.

    Note that you MUST call release() in order to release resources and avoid memory leak.

      • release

        public void release()
        You MUST call this method when @{link FrameSequenceView is no longer needed in order to release resources and avoid memory leak.

        Note: We are working on automatic resource release encapsulation. This method will be marked as Deprecated when done.

      • setupPreview

        public void setupPreview(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable drawable,
                         boolean animate)
        Set preview manually by calling this method.

        Note: If setShouldLoadPreview(boolean) is set to true then preview image will be replaced by the one loaded from FrameSequenceSource.loadPoster().

        Parameters:
        drawable - to use as preview, until FrameSequenceSource.loadFrameSequence() is being loaded.
        animate - set to true if transition animation needed.

      • setOnStartAnimationListener

        public void setOnStartAnimationListener(OnStartAnimationListener onStartAnimationListener)
        Subscribe for animation start. Will be called when frame sequence has loaded and animation starts.
        Parameters:
        onStartAnimationListener -

      • play

        public void play()
        Start WebP animation playback.

        Will download and play animated FrameSequenceSource.loadFrameSequence(), or play it instantly if it is already downloaded.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause animation playback.
